text: KLM Cityhopper is the regional airline subsidiary of KLM that was founded in April 1991. It is headquartered in Haarlemmermeer, Netherlands. It is a SkyTeam airline. It operated Fokker 50, Fokker 70, Fokker 100, Fokker F28 Fellowship and Saab-340 in the past. It currently operates Embraer 175 and Embraer 190 aircraft. ==Notable pilots== In 2017 Willem-Alexander, King of the Netherlands revealed that he had been flying secretly as a copilot twice a month for KLM Cityhopper for the past 21 years, including the state plane. ==Gallery== File:PH-OFC.JPG|A KLM Cityhopper Fokker 100 taking off Amsterdam. File:PH KZP KLM Cityhopper Fokker 70 pic2.JPG|A KLM Cityhopper Fokker 70 landing. KLM Cityhopper retired Fokker 70s in 2017. File:PH-KVK.JPG|A KLM Cityhopper Fokker 50 taking off Amsterdam File:KLM Embraer E175.jpg|An Embraer E175 == Other websites == * Official website Category:1991 establishments in the Netherlands Category:Airlines of the Netherlands
title: KLM Cityhopper
